question: 警察官
userExplanation:
the formal term
<ja>警官</ja> is the everyday term
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>police</kanji> (<ja>警察</ja>) <kanji>government</kanji> is full of <vocabulary>police officer</vocabulary>s. This is the formal way to say "police officer." It is similar to <ja>警官</ja>, but has a slightly more official feel to it.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
